intro: Antennaria farwellii, commonly known as the Farwell's mouse-eared moss, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features tiny, hairy leaves that are typically less than 1 centimeter in length. Its flowers are small, pinkish-white, and clustered in racemes, blooming in early spring. Antennaria farwellii thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and arctic environments.
